author: Doge Doggo

text: warning! its characterization of yukari is a travesty
author: Robert Simmons

text: @Robert Simmons Is not, bro. You have to understand how she feels, after what she saw. If you think it doesn't make sense, you aren't thinking.
author: WolfManjack
Robert Simmons

text:
@Robert Simmons
Trust me. It's an understandable reaction. You have somebody watch someone else die, feel like they're responsible... you're just not getting how human it really is.¬†
author: WolfManjack

text:
@CaptainThunderWolf¬†
i blame myself for giving my immune-suppressed father the pneumonia that killed him. i get the humanity of wanting someone back you feel responsible for killing.¬†

but having that person who takes that attitude in the answer be yukari is wrong. her whole S-link is about that attitude being wrong; that wallowing in self-pity is the reason her relationship with her mother fell apart; and that she does not want to be that person.

if anything the person most likely to take her attitude is Kirijo. she has lost so much to the dark hour, (Shinjiro, her father, now P3MC) that yukari's reaction would be more understandable. plus her S-link was about acting in her self-interests more than whats good for other people. which would fit her support for bringing P3MC a lot more than Canon Answer
author: Robert Simmons

text: @Robert Simmons¬†Dude. Does arguing fix anything?¬†
